item.title: Road markings are very worn, 6th September
item.description:
Yellow box markings are very worn and not particularly visible as the road falls away to the underpass. This is very important as camera monitoring this box is active. The camera position is elevated and so from the camera point it looks obvious but from ground level it is not so visible. I have paid my fine.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed car parked on Calvert close, 6th September
item.description:
Car reg - YY10GHZ, White Audi. This car has been parked on Calvert close for months now and is untaxed. The car doesn’t move during the day but the owner (who doesn’t live on the close) will return every so often (usually at night) drive the car and return it shortly after.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calvert Close, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak, 6th September
item.description:
There’s water coming up through the road. The drain is also blocked and there’s a large puddle outside no 46 that’s getting bigger. It’s been getting worse all week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Canonbury Park North, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned, 6th September
item.description:
Would like to report a car in a residential close in SE28. It's been there for over two years. I'm sure no MOT no insurance or tax. I have not seen anyone try and move it or even go to it in over two years. Could belong to a resident that's passed away or has been dumped. Alot of drug deals In area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfield Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch blocking cycle lanes, 6th September
item.description:
A large branch has broken off one of the trees and is now blocking both cycle lanes. The branch needs removing and the tree might needs some preventative pruning to ensure that more branches don't break.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Globe Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A dead animal at the back of my garden., 6th September
item.description:
I am in and out of the property due to a crime incident that happened in July. I popped in to do some laundry and to finish packing away items ready to move and I discovered a dead animal towards the back (for the first time, after living here for 7 years). Flies are all over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Sandway Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac sinking in resulting in an about 3 inches deep trough on Springfield Road between Maybourne Close and tennis club., 6th September
item.description:
This issue has occurred a few months after new pipes have been installed on this road. Could this have resulted in a cavity? The trough is deep enough to be dangerous for bicycle riders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lawrie Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
